Question_1.Context: The study investigated the root mycorrhizal colonization process of trifoliate orange and the responsive patterns of plant growth, root peroxide hydrogen (H2O2), antioxidant enzymes, and gene expression.
Question_1.Question: What was the root mycorrhizal colonization rate of Funneliformis mosseae at 56 days of inoculation?
Question_1.Source: Fm developed appressoriums on the root surface at 7 doi, followed by abundant arbuscules in root cortical cells at 28 doi, intracellular vesicles at 42 doi, and root mycorrhizal colonization rate of 41.54% at 56 doi.

Question_2.Context: The study focused on the changes in plant growth performance after inoculation with Funneliformis mosseae.
Question_2.Question: When did the growth performance in Fm-inoculated seedlings start to show significant improvement compared to no-Fm-inoculated seedlings?
Question_2.Source: Starting from 28 doi, the growth performance in Fm-inoculated seedlings was better than that in no-Fm-inoculated seedlings.

Question_3.Context: The study examined the changes in root H2O2 levels in response to Funneliformis mosseae inoculation.
Question_3.Question: When were root H2O2 levels significantly increased after Fm inoculation?
Question_3.Source: Compared with no-Fm inoculation, H2O2 levels in roots of Fm-inoculated seedlings were significantly increased only at 7 and 14 doi.

Question_4.Context: The study explored the changes in superoxide dismutase (SOD) activity in roots after inoculation with Funneliformis mosseae.
Question_4.Question: At which days of inoculation did Fm inoculation significantly increase root SOD activity?
Question_4.Source: Compared with no-Fm inoculation, Fm inoculation significantly increased root SOD activity at 7 and 56 doi.

Question_5.Context: The study investigated the relative expression of antioxidant enzyme genes in response to Funneliformis mosseae inoculation.
Question_5.Question: Which gene expression was distinctly increased at 7 and 14 days of inoculation after Fm colonization?
Question_5.Source: Compared with no-Fm inoculation, Fm inoculation distinctly up-regulated PtPOD expression at 7 and 14 doi.

Question_6.Context: The study examined the changes in the expression of root sugar transporter gene (PtSWEET) in response to Funneliformis mosseae inoculation.
Question_6.Question: When was the expression of root PtSWEET significantly up-regulated after Fm inoculation?
Question_6.Source: PtSWEET gene was significantly up-regulated from 28 doi of Fm, which was accompanied by the formation of arbuscules.

Question_7.Context: The study focused on the changes in the expression of fatty acid transporter protein genes (PtSTR and PtSTR2) in roots after inoculation with Funneliformis mosseae.
Question_7.Question: When was the expression of root PtSTR significantly up-regulated after Fm inoculation?
Question_7.Source: PtSTR expression was up-regulated from 28 doi, while PtSTR2 was up-regulated from 42 doi.

Question_8.Context: The study examined the changes in the expression of root phosphate transporter protein genes (PtPT3, PtPT5, and PtPT6) in response to Funneliformis mosseae inoculation.
Question_8.Question: When was the expression of root PtPT6 significantly up-regulated after Fm inoculation?
Question_8.Source: Root PtPT6 expression was up-regulated in Fm-inoculated plants from 28 doi.

Question_9.Context: The study investigated the establishment of symbiotic associations between AMF and trifoliate orange.
Question_9.Question: What was initiated at 28‒56 days of inoculation after the formation of arbuscules?
Question_9.D: Nutrient exchange between AMF and the host plant
Question_9.Source: At 28 doi, massive formation of arbuscule in the roots was accompanied by growth improvement, up-regulated expression of PtSWEET and PtSTR and subsequent up-regulated expression of PtPTs, suggesting the initiation of bidirectional nutrient functions.

Question_10.Context: The study provided insights into the defense response of trifoliate orange to mycorrhizal fungal colonization.
Question_10.Question: What was the response of the host plant to mycorrhizal fungal colonization at 7‒14 days of inoculation?
Question_10.B: Up-regulation of PtSWEET and PtSTR expression
Question_10.Source: Compared with no-Fm inoculation, H2O2 levels in roots of Fm-inoculated seedlings were significantly increased only at 7 and 14 doi, indicating the initiation of root antioxidant defense.
